page.title: 09Farming Chaldon Hills
page.content: Commercial forestry is undertaken by the Forestry Commission who have a 200 year lease (from 1958) from the Weld Estate on Burngate Wood in the South-East corner of the block. Around the perimeter Beech has been planted as a shelter belt. Within this Corsican Pine is grown as a commmercial crop. Oak and Ash which have established themselves naturally are left to develope as specimen trees where ever possible. There are no public rights of way within the Wood. Therefore the Weld Estate use it to rear pheasants which are shot by organised parties during the winter.
